entries.content: Cultivate 'detachment' from the sales outcome, but remain 'invested' in serving the prospect and doing your best.
Attachment to the outcome creates pressure, changes energy to needy or desperate.
Detachment gives freedom to be yourself, ask good questions, serve fully, and not worry about yes/no.
Detachment helps you not take rejection personally.
Focus on the sales process, not just the outcome. Ask: 'Did I ask good questions? Did I listen fully? Did I understand needs? Did I share clearly? Did I serve well?'
Remember your higher purpose or mission to help detach from the outcome of a single deal.
Practice mindfulness during calls: be present, observe thoughts without judgment, and let them go.
Let go of perfectionism; just do your best and be okay with the outcome to help detach.
Celebrate small wins (making calls, having conversations, asking questions) instead of only focusing on closing deals.
